nodes.text: Master von Urwald, you have a new reprobate from the gutters of Caligari city - Shawn O'Conner. Let me know as soon as he breaks the rules so that we can send him back where he belongs.
Very well. Welcome to our class, Herr O'Conner - take a seat.
I warn you, Conner... break one rule and you're out of here.
I am certain that Herr O'Conner will do what he can to avoid facing your wrath.
He's not to be trusted!
I am equally certain that you have better places to be than here, Mortimer. Guten Tag.

nodes.commentor: Terk walks to Door Exit Waypoint here

nodes.text: In honor of our new arrival, we shall have a review of the rules of Rogue Class. Herr Sosi, what is the first rule of Rogue Class?
There is no Rogue Class, sir.
Precisely. This is a university for Heroes. There are no Rogues in this school.
Fräulein MacMichael, what is the second rule of Rogue Class?
We don't talk of Rogue Class.
Indeed. This is officially the class of Disbarred Bards. Keep that in mind when speaking with others outside this classroom.
Herr Kyro, what is the third rule?
We will always show respect to the Master, Master.
A good rule to remember, indeed, if you wish to remain at this school. Always show respect to someone who has power over you when you are in their presence.
Fräulein Esme, what is the fourth rule of Rogue Class?
It is one that says ve aren't supposed to steal - from school or other classmates, no?
You are essentially correct, Fräulein. This is not the Thieves' Guild. This is not some Brigands' den. You will all treat one another with respect and cooperation.
Herr Kent, what is the fifth rule of Rogue Class?
We're at this school to be Heroes and we are expected to act appropriately, sir.
Precisely. Keep your goal of becoming a hero in mind and always work toward accomplishing it.
Now, Herr O'Conner, what do you think the sixth rule of Rogue Class might be?

options.text: Say Something Serious to Please Master von Urwald

nodes.text: Um... Always follow the School Rules?
We are Rogues here, not Paladins, Herr O'Conner. I expect my students to act appropriately.

options.text: Say Something Humorous to Amuse the Other Students

nodes.text:
As a Rogue, when fighting duels,
Only Fools follow the rules.
These are rules, not guidelines, Herr O'Conner. Rule number six is one rule you would do well to learn.

options.text: Say Something Snarky Just for Fun

nodes.text: Whatever you do, don't get caught!
You are correct, Herr O'Conner - it is a lesson you clearly need to learn.
The Rules for Rogues are posted in this classroom.
They will help you to maintain your status as a Disbarred Bard at this school. I suggest you all commit them to memory.
Tomorrow we will be discussing "Tools of the Trade" for Rogues. I suggest you all study the "Beginner's Guide to Picking Locks" and purchase a Lockpick kit at the School Store.
The rest of the afternoon is reserved for you to enhance your skills in the nearby Practice Room or study your lessons in the Library.
Klasse entlassen.

nodes.name: First Disbarred Bards Class
nodes.description:
Weird. We're not supposed to mention or talk about the fact we're in Rogue Class. Terk and the" Master" don't seem to get along. We've got a bunch of rules we're supposed to learn. And I need to study a book on lock picking and get a lockpick kit from the school store... wherever that is.

So maybe I can't be a Thief, but I can be a Rogue. What's the difference?
